messages.content: {"mitigation": "Revised Force Majeure Clause: \nIf a Force Majeure event (including natural disasters, war, terrorism, or other causes beyond reasonable control) prevents either party from performing its obligations, the affected party shall promptly (within fifteen (15) business days) notify the other party in writing, providing detailed information about the event and its anticipated impact. Performance shall be suspended for a period not exceeding sixty (60) days, after which the parties shall cooperate in good faith to resume performance or, if continuation is impracticable, may terminate the agreement upon mutual written agreement. Neither party shall be liable for damages arising solely from such suspension, provided that all reasonable mitigation steps are taken."}
